etymology.description: 阴(yīn, feminine/hidden) + 道(dào, path/channel) = vaginal canal.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “yin channel,” treating the vagina as a bodily passage associated with the feminine/yin principle. Standard in medical and anatomical contexts.
etymology.simplification: 陰 → 阴 simplifies the right component to 月 to reduce strokes; 道 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 在解剖学中(在解剖學中)，阴道是连接子宫和外阴的通道(陰道是連接子宮和外陰的通道)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiěpōuxué zhōng, yīndào shì liánjiē zǐgōng hé wàiyīn de tōngdào.
examples.english: In anatomy, the vagina is the canal connecting the uterus and the vulva.

examples.chinese: 医生解释阴道的结构(醫生解釋陰道的結構)。
examples.english: The doctor explained the structure of the vagina.

examples.chinese: 产科检查需要保持阴道清洁(產科檢查需要保持陰道清潔)。
examples.pinyin: Chǎnkē jiǎnchá xūyào bǎochí yīndào qīngjié.
examples.english: Obstetric examinations require keeping the vagina clean.
